Detailed Description

string.h: Strings and memory manipulation routines.

Function Documentation

void* memcpy ( void *  dest,
const void *  src,
size_t  size 
)

Copy an area of memory from src to dest.

Memory areas should not overlap.

Parameters:
dest Pointer to the destination area.
src Pointer to the source area.
size The size of memory to copy.

void* memset ( void *  s,
int  c,
size_t  size 
)

Set an area of memory with a value.

Parameters:
s Pointer to the area to set.
c Value you want to set the area.
size The size of memory to set.

int strcmp ( const char *  str1,
const char *  str2 
)

Compares two strings.

Parameters:
str1 First string.
str2 Second string.
Returns:
-1 if s1<s2, 0 if s1==s2, 1 if s1>s2.

char* strcpy ( char *  dest,
const char *  src 
)

Copy a string into a buffer.

Parameters:
dest Destination buffer.
src Source string.
Returns:
dest or NULL if src is NULL.

int strlen ( const char *  str  ) 

Calculate the length of a string.

Parameters:
str The string.
Returns:
The length of str.
